headline: Delta, American Airlines Increase Flights To Cushion Delays Caused By Trump's Restrictions On Carribean Operations Following Venezuela Raid
summary: Delta Airlines Inc. (NASDAQ:DAL), American Airlines Group Inc. (NASDAQ:AAL) have added several additional flights as thousands of travelers were left stranded in the Caribbean amid flight restrictions imposed by the President Donald Trump administration after it carried out a raid in Venezuela that led to the capture of President Nicolás Maduro. Students Left Stranded Due To Cancellations Students returning to school were left stranded due to the uncertainty around flights, Business Insider repo

headline: Qualcomm in talks with Samsung Electronics for contract manufacturing, South Korean newspaper says
summary: Qualcomm is in talks with Samsung Electronics ​over contract manufacturing of two-nanometre ‌chips, the U.S. company's CEO Cristiano Amon was ‌quoted by the Korea Economic Daily as saying on Wednesday. The South Korean paper cited Amon as saying ⁠that Qualcomm was ‌holding talks first with Samsung Electronics, among several semiconductor ‍foundry firms, about contract manufacturing using the latest two-nanometre process, with design work already ​completed for commercialisation in the ‌near future. Qualcomm was not immediately available for comment outside regular business hours.

headline: Why Elon Musk And Tesla Aren't 'Losing Sleep' Over Nvidia's Self-Driving Announcement
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk isn't losing any sleep over Nvidia's self-driving plans, but TSLA stock lost a key support level Tuesday.  Musk launched a flurry of social media posts on X following Nvidia's announcement late Monday that it was launching its own autonomous vehicle AI, and planned to test a robotaxi taxi service with unnamed partners by 2027.  At the CES conference in Las Vegas on Monday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced Alpamayo, Nvidia's autonomous vehicle AI system, which will come to the U.S. in Q1 2026 available in certain Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

content.title: Why Elon Musk And Tesla Aren't 'Losing Sleep' Over Nvidia's Self-Driving Announcement
content.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk isn't losing any sleep over Nvidia's self-driving plans, but TSLA stock lost a key support level Tuesday.  Musk launched a flurry of social media posts on X following Nvidia's announcement late Monday that it was launching its own autonomous vehicle AI, and planned to test a robotaxi taxi service with unnamed partners by 2027.  At the CES conference in Las Vegas on Monday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced Alpamayo, Nvidia's autonomous vehicle AI system, which will come to the U.S. in Q1 2026 available in certain Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

headline: GameStop announces stock option award for CEO tied to $100 billion market-cap target
summary: Jan ​7 (Reuters) - GameStop on Wednesday unveiled a ‌compensation package for CEO Ryan Cohen, hinging on a ‌turnaround that requires him to lift the struggling videogame retailer's market value more than tenfold and sharply boost profits.  The company said Cohen will receive no guaranteed ‍pay in the form of salary, cash bonuses or stock options under the package, making ​his compensation entirely "at-risk" of achieving the ambitious ‌targets.  The award resembles the 10-year incentive plan approved for Elon Musk at Tesla, under which compensation was tied entirely to stock options that vest only if ambitious ⁠market capitalization and operating ​profit goals are achieved.

content.title: GameStop announces stock option award for CEO tied to $100 billion market-cap target
content.summary: Jan ​7 (Reuters) - GameStop on Wednesday unveiled a ‌compensation package for CEO Ryan Cohen, hinging on a ‌turnaround that requires him to lift the struggling videogame retailer's market value more than tenfold and sharply boost profits.  The company said Cohen will receive no guaranteed ‍pay in the form of salary, cash bonuses or stock options under the package, making ​his compensation entirely "at-risk" of achieving the ambitious ‌targets.  The award resembles the 10-year incentive plan approved for Elon Musk at Tesla, under which compensation was tied entirely to stock options that vest only if ambitious ⁠market capitalization and operating ​profit goals are achieved.

headline: Tesla Door Design Is Targeted by New US Automotive Safety Bill
summary: The measure from Representative Robin Kelly, an Illinois Democrat, calls for automobiles with electric door systems to include a clearly labeled mechanical latch that is “intuitive to use and readily accessible for the occupant.”  The bill introduced late Tuesday is the first indication that safety risks posed by electrically powered vehicle doors have drawn the attention of lawmakers on Capitol Hill.  It adds to the growing scrutiny of electric vehicle doors following a series of incidents in which people were severely injured or died when they were unable to escape their vehicles.

content.title: Tesla Door Design Is Targeted by New US Automotive Safety Bill
content.summary: The measure from Representative Robin Kelly, an Illinois Democrat, calls for automobiles with electric door systems to include a clearly labeled mechanical latch that is “intuitive to use and readily accessible for the occupant.”  The bill introduced late Tuesday is the first indication that safety risks posed by electrically powered vehicle doors have drawn the attention of lawmakers on Capitol Hill.  It adds to the growing scrutiny of electric vehicle doors following a series of incidents in which people were severely injured or died when they were unable to escape their vehicles.

headline: GameStop details CEO's compensation package which doesn't include any guaranteed pay
summary: GameStop is providing details on a new compensation package for CEO Ryan Cohen that is dependent on him meeting certain “significant” performance targets.  The video game retailer said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday that Cohen would have to grow its market capitalization to $100 billion and it would need to hit $10 billion in cumulative performance EBITDA — or earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization — for his award to fully vest.  GameStop said Cohen won't receive any guaranteed pay, which it defines as no salary, no cash bonuses, and no stock that simply vests over time.

content.title: GameStop details CEO's compensation package which doesn't include any guaranteed pay
content.summary: GameStop is providing details on a new compensation package for CEO Ryan Cohen that is dependent on him meeting certain “significant” performance targets.  The video game retailer said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday that Cohen would have to grow its market capitalization to $100 billion and it would need to hit $10 billion in cumulative performance EBITDA — or earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization — for his award to fully vest.  GameStop said Cohen won't receive any guaranteed pay, which it defines as no salary, no cash bonuses, and no stock that simply vests over time.
